remarks: The join of two different lattice lines in a lattice plane equals the plane (version of ~ 2llnjN in terms of atoms).  (Contributed by NM, 5-Jul-2012.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
2llnja.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
2llnja.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
2llnja.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
2llnja.n $e |- N = ( LLines ` K ) $.
2llnja.p $e |- P = ( LPlanes ` K ) $.
2llnjaN $p |- ( ( ( ( K e. HL /\ W e. P ) /\ ( Q e. A /\ R e. A /\ Q =/= R ) /\ ( S e. A /\ T e. A /\ S =/= T ) ) /\ ( ( Q .\/ R ) .<_ W /\ ( S .\/ T ) .<_ W /\ ( Q .\/ R ) =/= ( S .\/ T ) ) ) -> ( ( Q .\/ R ) .\/ ( S .\/ T ) ) = W ) $.
